keyPolicies.policyDescription: Requiring local employers such as Rosyth dockyard to provide opportunities for young Fifers.
Raise paternity pay helping 4,000 local families a year to give their children the best start in life.
To replace or refurbish Woodmill High, St Columba's RC and Inverkeithing High.
So that people who come to the UK can't claim benefits for five years.
By introducing the living wage, giving 7,500 West Fifers a pay rise.

issues.economy: Building a fairer Scotland by introducing the living wage.
issues.education: Supporting investment in local schools to replace or refurbish Woodmill High, St Columba's RC and Inverkeithing High.
issues.immigration: Tough controls on immigration so that people who come to the UK can't claim benefits for five years.

images.caption: Thomas Docherty with two individuals in construction vests
